posts.title: Kubrick by Kubrick
posts.excerpt: Theatrical cut (13 minutes longer than TV cut, and has no TV bug markers). Stanley Kubrick’s mark on the legacy of cinema can never be measured. He was a giant in his field, his great works resembling pristine pieces of art, studied by students and masters alike, all searching for answers their maker was notoriously …

posts.title: Rembrandt
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:This character study joins the painter at the height of his fame in 1642, when his adored wife suddenly dies and his work takes a dark, sardonic turn that offends his patrons. By 1656, he is bankrupt but consoles himself with the company of pretty maid Hendrickje, whom he’s unable to marry. Their relationship brings …

posts.title: Like Wow!
posts.excerpt: A man finds magic glasses that allow him to see women naked.

posts._title: David Hughes & Ray Selfe – Emmanuelle in Soho (1981)
posts.title: Emmanuelle in Soho
posts.excerpt: Emanuelle lives in London where almost everything in the realm of erotic is available. Her friend Kate becomes a nude revue show to help her husband pay the bills.

posts._title: Paulo Rocha – Mudar de Vida AKA Change of Life (1966)
posts.title: Mudar de Vida
posts.excerpt: Quote:Paulo Rocha’s haunting second feature, CHANGE OF LIFE, is a beautifully-told story of a young man who returns from abroad to his small fishing village to discover that much has changed. Inspired by his work with Manoel de Oliveira, Rocha “cast” the local villagers as themselves, interspersed with experienced actors led by the great Isabel …

posts._title: Ján Kadár & Elmar Klos – Obchod na korze AKA The Shop on Main Street [+Extras] (1965)
posts.title: Obchod na korze
posts.excerpt: Quote:Fascist Slovakia during WW2. Tono lives a poor life, but the authorities offer him to take over the Jewish widow Lautman’s little shop for sewing material. She is old and confused and thinks that he is only looking for employment and hires him. The odd couple begin to like each other. But some time later …

posts._title: Alice Rohrwacher – Le quattro strade AKA Four Roads (2020)
posts.title: Le quattro strade
posts.excerpt: Quote:The COVID-19 pandemic forced many to stay at home, preventing people from meeting each other in real life. In the absence of any physical connection, this short explores alternative forms of contact among neighbors by making use of an old 16mm camera, a zoom lens, and a few meters of expired film.

posts._title: Rithy Panh – S21, la machine de mort Khmère rouge aka S21, the Khmer Rouge Killing Machine [+Extra] (2003)
posts.title: S21, la machine de mort Khmère rouge
posts.excerpt: Quote:“I survived because they liked my paintings,” says Vann Nath in this unsettling documentary, an affecting and effective film. This placid artist was imprisoned along with 17,000 other Cambodians in a Phnom Penh high school that had been converted into a Khmer Rouge interrogation and torture center. The school was used for this purpose for …
posts.titleEnglish: S21, the Khmer Rouge Killing Machine

posts._title: Hsiao-Hsien Hou – Tóngnián wangshì AKA A Time to Live and a Time to Die (1985)
posts.title: Tóngnián wangshì
posts.excerpt: The semi-autobiographical film on director Hou Hsiao-Hsien’s childhood and adolescence, when he was growing up in Taiwan, living through the deaths of his father, mother and grandmother.
posts.titleEnglish: A Time to Live and a Time to Die

posts._title: Alejandro Jodorowsky – La danza de la realidad AKA The Dance of Reality (2013)
posts.title: La danza de la realidad
posts.excerpt: In a Chilean little town, the son of an uprooted couple, formed by a rigorous communist father and a loving but weak mother, tries to pave his own path in a society that does not understand their Jewish-Ukrainian origins.
